channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Nothing Phone (3a) Pro dans un pack à -30 %, TV Philips OLED Ambilight 144 Hz à 730 € et Meta Quest 3 512 Go à prix cassé — les deals de la semaine
item.description: Vous n’avez pas eu le temps de suivre les bons plans de la semaine ? Voici ce que vous a loupé : le Nothing Phone (3a) Pro est dans un pack à -30 %, un TV Philips OLED Ambilight et 144 Hz à seulement 730 € et le Meta Quest 3 512 Go à prix cassé.

item.title: TV QD-OLED 2026 : Samsung display annonce un pic de luminosité record de 4500 cd/m² !
item.description: Samsung Display revendique une future dalle TV QD‑OLED 2026 capable d’atteindre 4500 cd/m² en HDR, une valeur nettement supérieure aux modèles 2024‑2025 déjà mesurés, et qui s’inscrit dans la course à la luminosité sur le marché des téléviseurs haut de gamme.

item.title: EV Makers Could Struggle in 2026, but Jeff Bezos Might Have a Great 2027
item.description: For the auto industry, reality is about to set in.

item.title: How to watch the Bosch CES 2026 press conference live on Monday
item.description: You might recognize Bosch as a home appliance name (thanks to its partnership with Siemens), but the German multinational brand's core business is really about providing the underlying technology and engineering that powers cars, homes and factories around the world. That focus is reflected at CES 2026, where much of what Bosch is unveiling is intended to be licensed to other companies rather than sold as Bosch-branded products on store shelves. Case in point is Bosch's automotive plans at CES. The company is showcasing what it calls "AI in the car," or more specifically, in the cockpit of the...

item.title: Stop Using Your Keyboard and Start Using Handy, a Free Speech-to-Text App
item.description: It’s called Handy, and it uses AI models to accurately convert your speaking voice into text—all for free.

item.title: Splash out or skimp? The pros and cons of choosing a more expensive VPN
item.description: In the world of VPNs, do you get what you pay for?

item.title: Meditation was my biggest life upgrade this year – here's the app I'm using to continue my hot streak in 2026
item.description: Down Dog’s Meditation app has been the perfect way for me to practice mindfulness in 2025 –here's how you can use it to do the same this year.

item.title: Norton VPN: 2025’s milestones and the roadmap for 2026
item.description: 2025 was a "turning-point year" for Norton VPN. From 25Gbps server upgrades to navigating a threat landscape changed by Generative AI, here is how the provider evolved over the last 12 months.

item.title: Final's latest DX over-ear headphones still aren't cheap — but if you need detail and faithful neutrality, they're the ones
item.description: The first closed-back design in Final Audio’s ‘DX’ range is also the most affordable – but that’s not the same as saying it’s in any way inexpensive…

item.title: Blood Feud: Oura’s Health Panels Versus Whoop’s Advanced Labs
item.description: It’s easier than ever to order your own blood draws, but direct-access testing won’t replace a doctor.

item.title: How to Manage Files on iOS and Android
item.description: You have more access to your phone’s file system than you may think.

item.title: I've been using the 'James Bond shower' method for years, and according to my smartwatch, it’s good for me — here's how to do it
item.description: Cold showers offer benefits for body and mind, but are miserable – here’s how to get the best of both worlds.

item.title: Voici les événements astronomiques les plus attendus de 2026, et ça commence dès ce soir !
item.description: L'année 2026 nous réserve son lot de bonnes raisons de regarder le ciel avec plusieurs événements attendus. Voici déjà une sélection de dates à noter dans votre calendrier pour cette année qui démarre.

item.title: Les téléviseurs de 2026 vont tout changer : Micro RGB, RGB Mini‑LED, HDR10+ Advanced et Dolby Vision 2, ces technologies qui veulent réinventer l’image
item.description: Une fois n’est pas coutume, le CES 2026 s’annonce comme un tournant pour le marché des téléviseurs. Le salon de Las Vegas verra le renforcement et l’élargissement des technologies Micro RGB, RGB Mini‑LED et l'arrivée de nouveaux formats HDR comme Dolby Vision 2 et HDR10+ Advanced. Voici ce qui vous attend pour 2026.
